SENT.plain: Lupus anticoagulants (LA) are acquired autoantibodies that can cause antiphospholipid syndrome
LAs prolong phospholipid-dependent coagulation tests, acting as nonspecific inhibitors that are neutralized in the presence of excess phospholipid
However, there is no gold standard test and the testing is influenced by a number of variables
This article summarizes laboratory testing for LAs, with particular focus on technical issues and limitations of testing
